name: acerbically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is direct, funny, and critical or unkind: "Thank you for explaining to me how to make toast," he said acerbically. The owners of the high-end deli were acerbically described as glorified sandwich makers.
More examplesFewer examplesShe pointed out acerbically that there was one day last month when he hadn't had a drink.The foreman referred to his men acerbically as inefficient load-carrying machines.The writer of the report couldn't resist commenting acerbically that there was little likelihood of the recommendations being implemented.
